title: Social media goes wild for Martin Odegaard after Real Madrid's on-loan star provides great assist
text:
Fans have taken to social media to applaud Martin Odegaard after the Real Madrid midfielder provided a sublime assist for his loan side Real Sociedad in their win over Alaves in La Liga.

The once highly-rated youngster laid on the assist for Mikel Oyarzabal's opener in their 3-0 win against Alaves at the Reale Arena.

The Norwegian international picks up the ball on the half turn, glides past an opponent with a nutmeg, before lifting his head up to spot Oyarzabal in open space to pierce a crisp pass to his team-mate.

Real Madrid loanee Martin Odegaard wowed fans with a sublime piece of skill on Thursday

Odegaard picked up the ball in Alaves' defensive third and evaded his opponent with a nutmeg

The 20-year-old picked his head up to see Mikel Oyarzabal free on the left hand side

The pass reaches Oyarzabal who fires home to give Real Sociedad the lead in the first half

Oyarzabal dispatched the ball into the bottom corner to give Sociedad the first of their three first half goals in their comfortable victory.

Fans were left stunned by the 20-year-old's invention to execute a pass not many footballers are capable of, and were quick to post on social media their reaction to the assist.

@SmnLlyd5 posted a clip of the assist with the comment: 'I could marry this Martin Odegaard assist'.

😍 WHAT AN ASSIST FROM MARTIN ØDEGAARD!



⚽ Real Sociedad take the lead over Alaves as Mikel Oyarzabal finishes off a nutmeg and perfectly weighted pass from the young Norwegian! pic.twitter.com/NdtFUeomPD — Premier Sports 📺 (@PremierSportsTV) September 26, 2019

Fans were quick to react on Twitter to Odegaard's wonderful assist for his loan club

@zayediqbal0 worte: 'What the f*** was that Odegard! You gotta explain this damn.. Received the ball, nutmegged, then sent the whole Alaves squad back to the kindergarten.'

@dylanwalsh_ said that the 20-year-old is proving critics wrong with his form for Sociedad, writing: 'Remember when everyone called Martin Odegaard a flop because he wasn’t Real Madrid’s best player at aged 15...'

Odegaard has scored two goals in his five appearances for Sociedad since joining the La Liga side on loan from Spanish giants Real Madrid this summer.

The youngster hasn't had the best time of it since his highly-publicized move to the Bernabeu but Madrid could be finally seeing the talent expected of the midfielder.
description: The once highly-rated youngster laid on the assist for Mikel Oyarzabal's opener in their 3-0 win against Alaves at the Reale Arena as he provided a world class pass for his team-mate.
